bibl.title: Greek and Demotic Loan Agreements in Epistolary Style. Formalisation and Registration in Later Ptolemaic Period.
bibl.note: 1. Types of loans. - 2. Greek autograph acknowledgments of debts: Towards a formal cheirographon (end second century B.C.). - 3. Demotic autograph acknowledgments of debt (late Ptolemaic period). - 4. Conclusions.

bibl.title: The Letter. Law, State, Society and the Epistolary Format in the Ancient World. Proceedings of a Colloquium Held at the American Academy in Rome 28-30.9.2008

bibl.seg: Katelijn Vandorpe, Greek and Demotic Loan Agreements in Epistolary Style. Formalisation and Registration in Later Ptolemaic Period.

Uri Yiftach-Firanko (ed.), The Letter. Law, State, Society and the Epistolary Format in the Ancient World. Proceedings of a Colloquium Held at the American Academy in Rome 28-30.9.2008 = Legal Documents in Ancient Societies (LDAS). 1 = Philippika. Marburger altertumskundliche Abhandlungen. 55, 1 (Wiesbaden, 2013) pp. 171-185, 2 tabl.

1. Types of loans. - 2. Greek autograph acknowledgments of debts: Towards a formal cheirographon (end second century B.C.). - 3. Demotic autograph acknowledgments of debt (late Ptolemaic period). - 4. Conclusions.
